name: FormattingHelper
description: The `FormattingHelper` class is a utility wrapper around Minecraft's `Formatting` enum that provides access to text formatting codes for colors and text modifiers. It represents standard Minecraft formatting options like colors (red, blue, green), styles (bold, italic, underline), and special effects (obfuscated, strikethrough) that can be applied to text in chat, HUD elements, and other text displays.

constructors.description: Constructs a new FormattingHelper instance wrapping a base Minecraft Formatting object.

methods.name: getColorValue
methods.description: Returns the RGB integer value of the color if this formatting is a color, otherwise returns 0.

methods.name: getColorIndex
methods.description: Returns the index of the color (0-15) if this formatting is a color, otherwise returns -1.

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Returns the name of the formatting code (e.g., 'red', 'bold').

methods.name: getCode
methods.description: Returns the single-character formatting code (e.g., 'c' for red, 'l' for bold).

methods.name: isColor
methods.description: Checks if this formatting represents a color code.

methods.name: isModifier
methods.description: Checks if this formatting represents a text style modifier.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of this formatting object.
